content: quote: Originally posted by Ira1945: This is neither a republican nor a democrat thing nor directed to either party, but a rant agains cheap ass politicians in general. way way too much of this "http://beltwayblips.dailyradar.com/story/california_congressman_calls_maryland_home_to_gain_tax/" me i am getting sick and tired of this bunch I used to respect Duke Cunningham until he wound up being a liar and a cheat and went to jail too much like him in congress both houses, both parties how do we clean this crap up? clean it up? either have a ballot with None of the Above on it or, instead of voting for the lesser of two evils come election time, vote for an unknown (from either party or maybe a third) - as they can't be any worse then what we're getting... and even if you think your vote would be wasted then I suggest that if we do vote for an unkown or a third party canidate the lack of votes to the incumbants would still amount to the above suggestion of none of the above. content: Wall street floods the political campaigns with billions of dollars. Our current scenario is what they were buying. Those that speak against the federal reserve do not get cash and air-time so therefore are labled "irrelevant". We vote for media darlings, and behind the scenes both parties are chums, they have the same ideology, and support the same invisible status-quo. To say just vote smarter, is not enough. Money is being created out of thin air. Ask yourself, what is it buying?
reply: Wall street floods the political campaigns with billions of dollars. Our current scenario is what they were buying. content: quote: Originally posted by soscorpio: Wall street floods the political campaigns with billions of dollars. Our current scenario is what they were buying. Those that speak against the federal reserve do not get cash and air-time so therefore are labled "irrelevant". We vote for media darlings, and behind the scenes both parties are chums, they have the same ideology, and support the same invisible status-quo. To say just vote smarter, is not enough. Money is being created out of thin air. Ask yourself, what is it buying? Of course, that statement was a simplification. We just aren't being critical thinkers - we take whatever crap is given to us, with nary a whimper until it's too late. Sometimes, I think our national motto should be "I Had No Idea". When we should pay attention, we don't, then when it's time to, the amount of time and effort needed is too great for a majority of us to bear.

Sometimes, I think our national motto should be "I Had No Idea". When we should pay attention, we don't, then when it's time to, the amount of time and effort needed is too great for a majority of us to bear.
